page.title: 19Road Safety in Thurlow
page.content: The Borough Council is frequently approached by the Parish Council about the upkeep of roadside footpaths, safety rails on bridges and the repair of potholes in the road after the winter. Reduction in council spending would explain these problems and also their reluctance to grit the roads in winter and to provide a much needed layby near the school to ease parents' parking problems ad the resulting congestion and safety hazard. Many drivers speed through the village despite the 40mph signs at both ends of the village and along the main street, obtained after a dialogue with the Borough lasting several years. Faulty and unreliable street lighting causes continual concern.
